\begin{problem*}{}{}
  Let $f(u)$ be a continuous function and,
  for any real number $u$, let $\floor{u}$ denote the
  greatest integer less than or equal to $u$.
  Show that for any $x>1$,
  \[
    \int_{1}^{x} \floor{u}(\floor{u}+1)f(u)\mathrm{d}u
    = 2\sum_{i=1}^{\floor{x}} i \int_{i}^{x} f(u)\mathrm{d}u
  .\]
\end{problem*}
